dmca.title: Use of Private Image
dmca.body:
Dear [private],

It has come to our attention that you have obtained and made use of a 
private image of a client of ours, a certain [private].

We have been made aware that the original image was made 'public' via a 
technical error within the infrastructure of the original website 
(www.flickr.com). As such, when you obtained the image it was under  
the Creative Commons Legal Code. After the technical error was  fixed 
our client then reserved all rights on the image and made it 'private'.

There are certain key points at issue in this matter. This primary one 
is that our client also currently uses her flickr account to advertise 
her business interest. She is obviously worried that potential clients  
of hers may discover this leaked image via a search engine and 
subsequently withdraw business. She is understandably worried also that 
friends and family may come across the publicly posted image. We are 
also aware that her initial approaches to you could be interpreted as 
aggressive, for which she apologies, but would still request that you 
remove the image from the [private] website that it is posted on.

At this point in time we would like to point out to you the last 
sentence of Clause 3 (License Grant) of the Creative Commons Legal Code 
(Attribution  2.0):

  "All rights not expressly granted by Licensor are hereby reserved."

And respectively request that you remove the image as requested. If you 
could do this we, and our client, will be very grateful. We do 
understand that it has become a point of principle for you at this 
stage, however we would also like to inform you that we are taking this 
matter seriously.

Yours sincerely

[private]
